Resolved Question Show me another » How do i get a mazda rx7? i am 16 and am looking for a good car, yes im talking about sports cars. I know it sounds rediculous because im so young. Except i work at a fast food restaurant making roughly $700 a month, no bills at all. I have saved up $2,000 dollars, never expected to have so much lol. Also parrents have given me the luxery of providing $5,000 dollars for my expence. (not 100% sure but i need to get to work somehow) Since i was realy young i wanted a rx7, i dont know how much to pay? if i end up getting one what should i do to it, i hear about soo many recalls and problems? or should i pick a different sports car? 2 years ago Report Abuse
Additional Details mazda rx7 1992-2002 FD3 2 years ago by Old Man Dirt Member since: 23 April 2008 Total points: 72,046 (Level 7) Add Contact Block
Best Answer - Chosen by Asker Do your home work. Read the guide on buying an RX7 at the RX7 club. Take your time on buying one. A few words of caution: Most of the problems with the RX7 can be traced back to one of two areas: 1. Improper operation. You have to make sure that the operating instructions are followed, especially engine start up and shut down. This car is not one for driving to and from school in. Once it is started up it needs to be run for at least 20 minutes before it should be shut down. 2. Maintenance. There is a tendency on these cars (Miata's have the same problem) is for the owner to be the mechanic. While most drivers could do a lot more of the repairs, there are some areas that these home schooled mechanics just do not pay enough attention too. 3. Get one ticket, or have one wreck and it will take more the 700 dollars a month for insurance. I might suggest that you find a beater (something cheap) and if you have room for a place to work on it the RX7. Keep the RX7 as a car to be used on special occasions and the el-cheapo for daily runs. 2 years ago Report Abuse Asker's Rating: Asker's Comment: ur 100% right on everything, i have read the manual and everything, but ive decided to get a tiburon... although if i do fall in love with the rx7 i might get a loan and pick one up... but my plans were from school and back
so thanks for the answers guys i realy appreciate it. Action Bar: 0 stars - mark this as Interesting! Email Comment ( 0 ) Save RSS

BTW a good rx-7 fd would cost about 10k $ . Try mr-2 or something like 240sx. 2 years ago Report Abuse by Craig M Member since: 11 December 2006 Total points: 4,188 (Level 4) Add Contact Block For your budget, you definitely need to look at the Gen1 RX-7, not the gen 3. FB (81-85) or SA(79-80) models in decent shape are well within your price range, and are very simple to fix. Terrific cars. You should be able to find a decent running one between $1500 and $5000 depending on things like body and interior condition. They come up for sale regularly on kijiji and in the classfied section of the rx7club website linked below.
One thing is if you live in a cold climate - most of this body style have carburetors and do not start easily in the cold without the block heater plugged in. Also, it's a light vehicle that is rear wheel drive, if you get any snow or ice in your area, spend th e money on good winter tires, preferably studded.
